intro: Rutidea seretii, commonly known as the velvetleaf acacia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is distinguished by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Rutidea seretii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various insects and small animals.
